events: learned painting and carpentry from his father
studied at the School of Fine and Applied Arts in Caracas
worked as an illustrator and criitic for the newspaper 'El Nacional'
director of the School of Fine Arts in Maracaibo
became a part of the Op Art Movement
work started to focus on structures and spaces
first exhibition at Signals Gallery in London
his work 'Spiral' is added to the collection of the Museum of Modern Art in New York
established the Jesús Soto Museum of Modern Art in his hometown Ciudad Bolívar, Venezuela
received the Lorenzo il Magnifico Award for Lifetime Achievement
